00001 /* File find_molecules.c begun on 20080625 by BLFoley 
00002         Purpose: Contain functions designed to determine which atoms and/or
00003         residues are parts of molecules and to separate them into molecules.
00004 
00005         For example, find_molecules_molbond_array will:
00006                 Given an array of molbond structures, use the bonding to 
00007                 determine which atoms (and residues) are parts of molecules.
00008                 The molecules found will also be numbered. */
00009 
00010 // change this before adding to library -- doesn't need whole prmtop header
00011 // this is here because the first function written was written for a read
00012 // of an amber prmtop file.
00013 #include "AMBER/amber_prmtop.h"
00014 
00015 typedef struct {
00016         int n; // number of
00017         int *i; // n of these 
00018 } tempintset;
00019 
00020 void follow_find_molecule_amber_prmtop_bond_target(molbond *MB, molindex *AT, tempintset *SI, tempintset *TI, int i, int mN);
00021 
00022 /***************  find_molecules_molbond_array() ******************/
00023 /* Finds molecules in a molbond array based on bonding patterns 
00024         Updates an array of NATOM molindices with molecule information.
00025         Also writes molecule info to the molbond array.  
00026         In both cases, it overwrites existing information. 
00027         NOTES:  
00028         1.  There should be no useful molecule or residue information
00029         in the molbond array (it will be igored).
00030         2.  The index, i, in the molindex structures should correspond to the
00031         absolute atom number as indexed in the molindex array.
00032         This way, any residue and atom info you have previously will
00033         be retained -- and it makes this function loads easier to write.
00034         Later, you can renumber your residues and atoms however you like,
00035         but any existing molecule information will be overwritten.
00036 */
00037 void find_molecules_molbond_array(int nMB, molbond *MB, int NATOM, molindex *AT){
00038 int a=0,currmol=0,localmol=0; // current and local molecule numbers
00039 tempintset *SI,*TI;
00040 
00041 // set all AT molecule indices to -1 (not seen)
00042 for(a=0;a<NATOM;a++){
00043 //printf("(find mols) AT[%d].a is %d ; .i is %d \n",a,AT[a].a,AT[a].i);
00044         AT[a].m=-1;
00045         }
00046 
00047 // index each source and target to all relevant indices in the AT array
00048 //      calloc space  (other way???)
00049 SI=(tempintset*)calloc(NATOM,sizeof(tempintset));
00050 TI=(tempintset*)calloc(NATOM,sizeof(tempintset));
00051 for(a=0;a<NATOM;a++){ // allocate space 
00052         SI[a].i=(int*)calloc(1,sizeof(int));
00053         TI[a].i=(int*)calloc(1,sizeof(int)); }
00054 // set backward indices for the atoms to the bonds
00055 //for(a=0;a<nMB;a++){
00056 //printf("MB[%d] : s = %d ; t = %d\n",a,MB[a].s.i,MB[a].t.i);}
00057 for(a=0;a<nMB;a++){ 
00058 //printf("SI[MB[a].s.i].n is %d TI[MB[a].t.i].n is %d \n",SI[MB[a].s.i].n,TI[MB[a].t.i].n);
00059         SI[MB[a].s.i].n++;
00060         TI[MB[a].t.i].n++;
00061         SI[MB[a].s.i].i=(int*)realloc(SI[MB[a].s.i].i,SI[MB[a].s.i].n*sizeof(int));
00062         TI[MB[a].t.i].i=(int*)realloc(TI[MB[a].t.i].i,TI[MB[a].t.i].n*sizeof(int));
00063         SI[MB[a].s.i].i[SI[MB[a].s.i].n-1]=a;
00064         TI[MB[a].t.i].i[TI[MB[a].t.i].n-1]=a;
00065 //printf("  MB[%d].s.i is %d ; SI[MB[a].s.i].n-1 is %d \n",a,MB[a].s.i,SI[MB[a].s.i].n-1);
00066 //printf("  MB[%d].t.i is %d ; TI[MB[a].t.i].n-1 is %d \n",a,MB[a].t.i,TI[MB[a].t.i].n-1);
00067         }
00068 //for(a=0;a<NATOM;a++){
00069 //printf("SI[%d].n is %d\n",a,SI[a].n); 
00070 //for(b=0;b<SI[a].n;b++){
00071 //printf("\tSI[%d].i[%d] is %d\n",a,b,SI[a].i[b]);
00072 //}
00073 //printf("TI[%d].n is %d\n",a,TI[a].n); 
00074 //for(b=0;b<TI[a].n;b++){
00075 //printf("\tTI[%d].i[%d] is %d\n",a,b,TI[a].i[b]);
00076 //}
00077 //}
00078 //for(a=0;a<nMB;a++){
00079 //printf("MB[%d] : s = %d ; t = %d\n",a,MB[a].s.i,MB[a].t.i);}
00080 
00081 // Find the molecules
00082 for(a=0;a<nMB;a++){ // loop through the molbond array 
00083         localmol=-1; // = we don't know the local molecule number yet
00084         // see if s or t already belong to a molecule 
00085         // if so, set localmol to that number
00086 //printf("MB[%d].s.i is %d ;  AT[MB[a].s.i].m is %d  ; MB[a].t.i is %d ;  AT[MB[a].t.i].m is %d  \n",a,MB[a].s.i,AT[MB[a].s.i].m,MB[a].t.i,AT[MB[a].t.i].m);
00087         if(AT[MB[a].s.i].m!=-1) {localmol=AT[MB[a].s.i].m;}
00088         if(AT[MB[a].t.i].m!=-1) {
00089                 if(localmol!=-1){
00090                         if(AT[MB[a].t.i].m!=AT[MB[a].s.i].m){
00091                         mywhine("molecule mismatch in find_molecules_molbond_array");} }
00092                 if(localmol==-1){ localmol=AT[MB[a].s.i].m=AT[MB[a].t.i].m;}
00093                 else {AT[MB[a].t.i].m=localmol;}
00094                 }
00095         // if we still don't know the local molecule number
00096         if(localmol==-1){ // set localmol to currmol and increment currmol
00097                 localmol=currmol;
00098                 currmol++;
00099                 // set s and t AT's as belonging to localmol
00100                 AT[MB[a].s.i].m=AT[MB[a].t.i].m=localmol;
00101                 }
00102         // set molecule info local to the bonds, too
00103         MB[a].s.m=MB[a].t.m=localmol; 
00104         follow_find_molecule_amber_prmtop_bond_target(MB,AT,SI,TI,MB[a].t.i,localmol);
00105         }
00106 // check our work:
00107 for(a=0;a<nMB;a++){ 
00108         if(MB[a].s.m==-1) {mywhine("source MB molecule not defined at end of assignment.");}
00109         if(MB[a].t.m==-1) {mywhine("target MB molecule not defined at end of assignment.");}
00110         }
00111 for(a=0;a>NATOM;a++){ // assign lone atoms to molecules
00112         if(AT[a].m==-1){
00113                 AT[a].m=currmol;
00114                 currmol++;
00115                 } 
00116         }
00117 
00118 return;
00119 }
00120 
00121 /************** follow_find_molecule_amber_prmtop_bond_target() ************/
00122 /* Follow bonds along the molecule recursively */
00123 void follow_find_molecule_amber_prmtop_bond_target(molbond *MB, molindex *AT, tempintset *SI, tempintset *TI, int i, int mN){
00124 int b=0; // for counting 
00125 
00126 //Each bond indicator has a source atom and a target atom.  So, for each target atom,
00127 //(1) find all bonds for which that target is a source
00128 //printf("in recursive follow at top\n");
00129 //printf("m is %d ; the atom index, i, is %d ; SI[i].n is %d ; TI[i].n is %d \n",mN,i,SI[i].n,TI[i].n);
00130 
00131 for(b=0;b<SI[i].n;b++){
00132 //printf("SI-i=%d (recursive follow, m=%d) the first source bond is %d  \n",i,mN,SI[i].i[b]);
00133 //printf("\t the source-target atoms are %d-%d ; its molecule is %d \n",MB[SI[i].i[b]].s.i,MB[SI[i].i[b]].t.i,AT[MB[SI[i].i[b]].s.i].m);
00134         if((AT[MB[SI[i].i[b]].s.i].m!=-1)&&(AT[MB[SI[i].i[b]].s.i].m!=mN)){mywhine("AT[MB[x].s.i].m!=-1)&&(AT[MB[x].s.i].m!=mN, in recursive follow\n");}
00135         //if(AT[MB[SI[i].i[b]].t.i].m!=-1) continue;  
00136         AT[MB[SI[i].i[b]].s.i].m=mN; // set molecule for the source
00137         if(AT[MB[SI[i].i[b]].t.i].m==-1){
00138                 AT[MB[SI[i].i[b]].t.i].m=mN; // set molecule for the target
00139                 follow_find_molecule_amber_prmtop_bond_target(MB,AT,SI,TI,MB[SI[i].i[b]].t.i,mN); }
00140         }
00141         //-- set their targets as belonging to the molecule
00142                 //(check to be sure not already marked someone else's)
00143         //-- call this function for each of the targets
00144 //(2) find all bonds for which that target is a target
00145         //-- set their sources as belonging to the molecule
00146         //-- call this function for each of the sources
00147 // best to do this recursively....
00148 // also set all targets for that atom as belonging
00149 for(b=0;b<TI[i].n;b++){
00150 //printf("TI-i=%d (recursive follow, m=%d) the first source bond is %d  \n",i,mN,TI[i].i[b]);
00151 //printf("\t the source-target atoms are %d-%d ; its molecule is %d \n",MB[TI[i].i[b]].t.i,MB[TI[i].i[b]].s.i,AT[MB[TI[i].i[b]].t.i].m);
00152         if((AT[MB[TI[i].i[b]].t.i].m!=-1)&&(AT[MB[TI[i].i[b]].t.i].m!=mN)){mywhine("AT[MB[x].t.i].m!=-1)&&(AT[MB[x].t.i].m!=mN, in recursive follow\n");}
00153         //if(AT[MB[TI[i].i[b]].t.i].m!=-1) continue;
00154         AT[MB[TI[i].i[b]].t.i].m=mN; // set molecule for the target
00155         if(AT[MB[TI[i].i[b]].s.i].m==-1){ // set molecule for the target
00156                 AT[MB[TI[i].i[b]].s.i].m=mN; // set molecule for the source
00157                 follow_find_molecule_amber_prmtop_bond_target(MB,AT,SI,TI,MB[TI[i].i[b]].s.i,mN); }
00158         }
00159 return;
00160 }
